headlines.description: Luke Maye scored 20 points and No. 9 North Carolina held on to give coach Roy Williams his 400th victory at the school, a 93-81 win over Bucknell on Wednesday night in the on-campus round of the PK80.
headlines.shortLinkText: Maye, No. 9 UNC hold on to beat Bucknell, 93-81

headlines.description: Amir Coffey, Reggie Lynch and Jordan Murphy all scored 18 points as No. 14 Minnesota pulled away from Niagara for a 107-81 victory on Wednesday night.

headlines.description: Khyri Thomas had a career-high 24 points, 11 rebounds and five assists, Martin Krampelj added a career-high 17 points and Creighton beat No. 20 Northwestern 92-88 on Wednesday night in a Gavitt Tipoff Games matchup.

headlines.description: Kris Wilkes scored 20 points, including five straight in overtime, and No. 23 UCLA rallied past stubborn Central Arkansas 106-101 on Wednesday, hours after three of the Bruins' freshmen confessed to shoplifting in China and were indefinitely suspended.
headlines.shortLinkText: No. 23 UCLA escapes with 106-101 win over Central Arkansas

video.headline: UCLA avoids upset, beats Central Arkansas in OT

headlines.description: Jevon Carter and Daxter Miles scored 20 points each to lead No. 24 West Virginia to a 98-64 victory over American on Wednesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: No. 24 WVU overcomes sluggish start to beat American 98-64

headlines.description: Dexter McClanahan made five of Savannah State's 15 3-pointers and scored 26 points to help the Tigers beat NAIA Middle Georgia State 114-80 on Wednesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Savannah State beats NAIA Middle Georgia State 114-80

headlines.description: J.T. Miller scored 16 points, Alize Johnson had 10 points, 14 rebounds and five assists, and Missouri State beat Southern 86-58 on Wednesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Missouri State beats winless Southern 86-58 in home opener

headlines.description: Ryan Luther had 13 points, including three 3-pointers, and 10 rebounds to help Pittsburgh its first win of the season Wednesday night, a 70-62 victory over UC Santa Barbara.
headlines.shortLinkText: Pitt outlasts UC Santa Barbara for first won of season

headlines.description: Lamar Stevens scored 15 of his 25 points in the second half and Penn State beat Montana 70-57 on Wednesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Stevens leads Penn State to 70-57 win over Montana

headlines.description: Elijah Bryant scored 22 points, TJ Haws added 10 points and made key free throws late in the game to help BYU beat Princeton 65-56 on Wednesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Bryant scores 22; BYU pulls away late, beats Princeton 65-56

headlines.description: A.J. Davis had 15 points and 10 rebounds, Chad Brown added 10 points, 10 boards and five blocks for his first career double-double, and Central Florida held off Gardner-Webb for a 68-65 win on Wednesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: UCF fights off winless Gardner-Webb 68-65 behind Davis

headlines.description: Ed Polite Jr. scored 17 points and grabbed six rebounds as Radford edged East Carolina 73-66 on Wednesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Radford edges East Carolina 73-66

headlines.description: Jessie Govan scored 20 points and pulled down 14 rebounds and Georgetown gave new head coach Patrick Ewing another victory, beating Mount St. Mary's 102-68 on Wednesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Govan leads Georgetown to another victory, 102-68

headlines.description: Devin Peterson scored 15 points with six rebounds, six assists and four steals and Western Carolina picked up its first victory of the season, winning its home opener against Hiwassee 76-57 on Wednesday night.

headlines.shortLinkText: UNC Greensboro beats Division III NC Wesleyan 82-48

headlines.description: Femi Olujobi hit 13 of 15 shots from the field to post 29 points to go with nine rebounds and North Carolina A&T built a double-digit lead in the first half and made it stand up in a 92-73 win at The Citadel Wednesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Olujobi shoots North Carolina A&T past The Citadel, 92-73

headlines.description: Kason Harrell scored 20 points and Fort Wayne made 17 3-pointers and beat Delaware State 85-71 on Wednesday night.

headlines.shortLinkText: Massinburg leads Buffalo to 81-76 win over Jacksonville St.

headlines.description: Stevie Jordan scored 19 points with nine rebounds and eight assists as Rider dealt Hartford its first loss of the season, 89-53 on Wednesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Rider cruises to 89-53 win over Hartford

headlines.shortLinkText: William & Mary holds off Hampton from the line, 83-76

headlines.description: Ryan Betley and Caleb Wood scored 13 points apiece and Pennsylvania used a big first half to roll past Navy 66-45 on Wednesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Penn has big first half, rolls in 66-45 victory over Navy

headlines.description: Matt Harris tied a career-high with seven 3-pointers and he scored 23 points to help UMass Lowell beat Marist 76-73 on Wednesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Harris ties career-high with 7 3s, UMass Lowell wins 76-73

headlines.description: Travis McConico scored 16 points and grabbed nine rebounds and Charleston Southern posted its first victory this season, winning in its home opener over Columbia International 98-58 on Wednesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Charleston Southern gets its first win of the season, 98-58

headlines.description: Payton Banks and Stephan Jiggetts each hit four 3-pointers and finished with 18 points on Wednesday night, and Terrence Samuel had 15 points, eight rebounds and seven assists to help South Florida beat Stetson 75-72 for coach Brian Gregory's 250th...
headlines.shortLinkText: Banks, Jiggetts score 18 apiece; USF beats Stetson 75-72

headlines.description: Jarrey Foster scored 19 points, Ben Emelogu II had 17 points and a career-high nine rebounds, and SMU routed Northwestern State 81-35 on Wednesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: SMU throttles cold-shooting Northwestern State 81-35

headlines.description: Kevon Harris scored 18 points and Shannon Bogues added another 17 off the bench as Stephen F. Austin cruised past Division II St. Edwards University, 89-66 on Wednesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Stephen F. Austin pulls away from D-II St. Edwards, 89-66

headlines.description: Nick Dixon scored 39 points, two off his career high, and UT Rio Grande Valley topped Texas A&M Corpus Christie 82-75 in overtime on Wednesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: UT Rio Grande Valley beats Texas A&M-CC 82-75 in OT

headlines.description: Freshman guard Trae Young had 22 points and 13 assists for his second double-double in as many games and Oklahoma rolled past Ball State 108-69 on Wednesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Young's double-double sends Oklahoma to 108-69 win

headlines.description: Dalan Ancrum scored 21 points, including three 3-pointers in the final five minutes, and grabbed 11 boards to give Western Illinois a 56-54 victory over Eastern Illinois Wednesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Ancrum leads Western Illinois over Eastern Illinois 56-54

headlines.description: Tevonn Walker posted 22 points and collected four steals as Valparaiso passed its first road test of the season, knocking off SIU-Edwardsville, 94-69 on Wednesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Valparaiso passes road test at SIU-Edwardsville, 94-69

headlines.description: Jhivvan Jackson scored 15 points including a pair of free throws with eight seconds remaining as UT San Antonio used a 12-4 run over the final 42 seconds to upend Texas State 79-78 on Wednesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: UTSA uses last-minute rally to beat Texas St. 79-78

headlines.description: Matthew Butler had 16 points and five assists, Fatodd Lewis scored 15 points and grabbed 11 rebounds and UT-Martin beat North Carolina Central 74-57 on Wednesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Butler, Lewis lead UT-Martin to 74-57 win over NC Central

headlines.description: Freshman Dayton Gumm scored a season-high 25 points, two Austin Peay players had double-doubles and the Governors beat Division II Oakland City 109-50 on Wednesday night in their home opener.
headlines.shortLinkText: Gumm scores 25, Austin Peay beats DII Oakland City 109-50

headlines.description: Dwight Coleby had a career-high 19 points and 10 rebounds for his second career double-double, Justin Johnson added 10 points and eight boards, and Western Kentucky beat Kentucky Wesleyan 83-53 on Wednesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Western Kentucky 83, Kentucky Wesleyan 53.

headlines.description: Anthony Cowan had 25 points and 10 rebounds, both career highs, and Maryland used a strong shooting performance to beat Butler 79-65 Wednesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Cowan scores 25 to carry Maryland past Butler 79-65

headlines.description: Carter Skaggs had 26 points and seven rebounds, and Viont'e Daniels added 17 points as Washington State beat Seattle University 75-59 on Wednesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Skaggs scores 26, Washington State beats Seattle 75-59

headlines.description: Vladimir Brodziansky had 23 points plus a key assist late as TCU held on for its eighth straight victory, 76-71, over South Dakota on Wednesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Brodziansky 23 points as TCU wins 8th in row, 76-71 over SD

headlines.description: DeAngelo Isby scored 17 points and grabbed five rebounds as Utah State buried Mississippi Valley State 83-47 on Wednesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Isby with 17 as Utah State buries MVSU 83-47

headlines.description: Eli Scott scored 21 points and Loyola Marymount defeated UC Riverside 76-64 on Wednesday night for its first win this season.
headlines.shortLinkText: Freshman Scott scores 21 in Loyola Marymount's 76-64 victory

headlines.description: Isaiah Wright scored 17 points with eight rebounds and six assists as San Diego kept Robert Morris winless with a 65-53 victory at the Grand Canyon Classic on Wednesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: San Diego beats Robert Morris 65-53

headlines.description: Cody Martin and Jordan Caroline combined to score 43 points as Nevada picked up its third win to start the season, rolling past Santa Clara 93-63 on Wednesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Martin, Caroline lead Nevada past Santa Clara, 93-63

headlines.description: Anthony Smith scored 17 points and Jordan Johnson tallied 16 points, and UNLV rolled to a 98-63 victory against winless Prairie View A&M on Wednesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: UNLV controls Prairie View A&M from the start in 98-63 win

headlines.description: Hank Hollingsworth had 10 points, 11 rebounds -- both career highs -- and three blocked shots to help Cal Poly cruise to a 76-47 win over Division II Holy Names on Wednesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Hollingsworth leads Cal Poly to 76-47 win over Holy Names

headlines.description: Tyler Hall scored 32 points and Montana State beat NAIA Montana Western 109-81 on Wednesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Hall scores 32; Montana State beats Montana Western 109-81

nowFeed.headline: USC junior forward Bennie Boatwright will miss the rest of the season after suffering a left patella injury during Thursday's win, per the school. Was averaging 13.6 points and 6.4 rebounds.

nowFeed.story: Back at @KUHoops Brings back a great memory thanks to a great group of players. @LBSUhoops vimeo.com/256137612

nowFeed.headline: Under Sean Miller Deandre Ayton is maximizing his enormous potential. Ayton has always possessed the physical tools and a solid basketball IQ. He has worked hard at Zona along with making the adjustments to college basketball. For a freshman big man it's really hard to dominate right away. Since he arrived in the states he was a top ranked player in his class. Would have been top 5 in last years NBA draft. Now he will be a top 3 pick and will be much more prepared.
nowFeed.story: Under Sean Miller Deandre Ayton is maximizing his enormous potential. Ayton has always possessed the physical tools and a solid basketball IQ. He has worked hard at Zona along with making the adjustments to college basketball. For a freshman big man it's really hard to dominate right away. Since he arrived in the states he was a top ranked player in his class. Would have been top 5 in last years NBA draft. Now he will be a top 3 pick and will be much more prepared.

nowFeed.headline: Cincinnati shot just 6-for-19 (31.6%) in the second half vs. Houston, including a FG drought of nearly 12 minutes down the stretch. The Bearcats got out rebounded 36-27. Both of those bit them tonight.
nowFeed.story: Cincinnati shot just 6-for-19 (31.6%) in the second half vs. Houston, including a FG drought of nearly 12 minutes down the stretch. The Bearcats got out rebounded 36-27. Both of those bit them tonight.

nowFeed.headline: Cincinnati's loss at Houston will likely drop them from the No. 2-seed line in Joe Lunardi's Bracketology, with Texas Tech likely being the beneficiary to move up. The Cougars, who were a 10-seed coming into the night, scored another big resume win after picking one up over Wichita State in January.
nowFeed.story: Cincinnati's loss at Houston will likely drop them from the No. 2-seed line in Joe Lunardi's Bracketology, with Texas Tech likely being the beneficiary to move up. The Cougars, who were a 10-seed coming into the night, scored another big resume win after picking one up over Wichita State in January.

nowFeed.headline: Houston upsets No. 5 Cincinnati 67-62, ending the Bearcats nation-leading 16-game winning streak. It's the first time the Cougars have beaten two top-10 opponents in a season since 1984.
nowFeed.story: Houston upsets No. 5 Cincinnati 67-62, ending the Bearcats nation-leading 16-game winning streak. It's the first time the Cougars have beaten two top-10 opponents in a season since 1984.

nowFeed.headline: Ironically, Cincinnati's loss to Houston also finally gives Cincinnati its first win over a likely NCAA Tournament team.
nowFeed.story: Ironically, Cincinnati's loss to Houston also finally gives Cincinnati its first win over a likely NCAA Tournament team.

nowFeed.headline: Cincinnati getting it done at the foul line tonight, hitting 17-of-21 free throw attempts. The Bearcats are hanging on to a 50-49 lead over Houston with 4:10 left.
nowFeed.story: Cincinnati getting it done at the foul line tonight, hitting 17-of-21 free throw attempts. The Bearcats are hanging on to a 50-49 lead over Houston with 4:10 left.
